item.title: Caloric heroes rise from data, not guessing
item.dc:creator: Jefferson Smith
item.description:
The preliminary research I did to sanity check my basic premise contained several surprises. First: All the sources I could find about high calorie crops seem to have completely missed the seaweed option. Second: They all cited Jerusalem artichokes as one of the champion crops, even though it didn't make my top ten, once I'd factored in field area and time to harvest. And those surprises have taught me a useful lesson...

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Caloric Power Table, version 1.0
item.dc:creator: Jefferson Smith
item.description:
Preliminary research conducted under Target Sanity Check has now concluded and released a table of potential crops that appear to have high caloric power. This primary purpose of this table is to help focus the next stage of my research, but it might also be of interest to anyone trying to choose crops for their own projects.

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Target "Sanity Check" has been met
item.dc:creator: Jefferson Smith
item.description:
Several crops were identified with sufficient yield to meet daily caloric needs indefinitely, in the context of a small-footprint indoor farm.

RECOMMENDATION: Proceed with trial crops of salsify, kelp, and leek.

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Target "Sanity Check" is greenlit
item.dc:creator: Jefferson Smith
item.description:
GOAL: Determine whether it is feasible for an indoor farm to be run by one person in reasonable space and produce enough calories to sustain them indefinitely.

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)
